newsitem.title: USA: NYC water board says may delay $371 mln bond sale.
newsitem.headline: NYC water board says may delay $371 mln bond sale.

text.p: The New York City Municipal Water Finance Authority on Thursday said it was considering whether to delay by one week an approximately $371 million bond sale to the week of Oct 21.

Alan Anders, the authority's treasurer, explained that the agency expects to make its determination tomorrow. "We're going to consider tomorrow whether to come next week or put it off to the following week."

A spokesman for the water authority explained it was concerned that the calendar of offerings for the week of Oct 16 might be full and also wanted to make certain that its audited financial statements are finished in time.
The authority officials, who spoke at a conference for investors, also said that in April 1997 the agency expects to sell around $400 million of new money bonds.
